title: Strategies for Applying UDL in Inclusive Early Childhood Education: Linking to Vygotsky's Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary early childhood education theories and classroom management experience
context.additional_context: A course to strengthen competency in designing math-integrated curricula, limited to smartphone-based learning activities.

learning_goals: Learners can design inclusive classroom environments for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) by applying UDL 3.0 principles
Learners establish developmentally appropriate learning support strategies for individual children using Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development (ZPD) theory
Learners implement UDL-based activities using smartphone-accessible digital tools (video conferencing platforms, simple collaboration apps)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
